intro: Lens esculenta var. subsphaerosperma, commonly known as the spherical lentil, is a variety of the common lentil characterized by its round, plump seeds. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is native to regions of the Mediterranean and South Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, producing small, pod-like fruits that contain the edible seeds. Its seeds are rich in protein and fiber, making it a valuable crop for both human consumption and animal feed. The spherical shape of the seeds distinguishes this variety from other lentil types and may influence its culinary uses.
